epgy.util
Class EPGYRobotState

java.lang.Object
  epgy.util.EPGYRobotState

public class EPGYRobotState
extends Object

This class represents the state of a robot at a given point in time. The EPGYRobotState is used mainly to store past states, and can be useful in referencing a past state of the enemy.

Author:
Matthew Chun-Lum

Field Summary
 double absoluteBearing
          The absolute bearing in radians to the robot for this state
 boolean accelerating
          true if the robot is accelerating
 double advancingVelocity
          The advancing velocity is the enemy velocity towards your direction
 boolean breaking
          true if the robot is breaking
 double deltaH
          The change in heading in radians
 double deltaV
          The change in velocity from the last state
 int directionTraveling
          1 for clockwise and -1 for counter clockwise relative to your position
 double distance
          The distance from your robot for this state
 double energy
          The energy of the robot
 double heading
          The heading in radians
 double lateralVelocity
          The lateral velocity is the the enemy velocity that is perpendicular to the absolute bearing
 EPGYPoint location
          The location of the robot for this state
 double timeSinceDirectionChange
          The time in ticks since the root changed directions
 double timeSinceStop
          The time in ticks since the robot stopped
 double timeSinceVelocityChange
          The time in ticks since the robot changed velocity
 double velocity
          The velocity for the robot
